other_tests.findings: The liver demonstrates no focal or textural abnormalities. There is no intra- or extra-hepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The gallbladder is normal in appearance without stones or wall edema. The common bile duct is normal in caliber measuring 3 mm. The body and head of the pancreas appear unremarkable. The tail of the pancreas is slightly obscured by overlying bowel gas. There is no perihepatic ascites. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow.
